name: WP E-Cards
author: Michael Torbert and Semper Plugins

sections.description:
This plugin allows you to easily create a post or page that acts as a virtual postcard application for your site visitors.
Add it to one post or create your own ecard site using the built in WordPress category and page functionality.
* Template files and CSS classes allow you to customize look and feel quickly
* Manage available photos for each card with the built in WordPress Media Manager
* Place the [wpecards] tag in your post content and publish

This plugin is very much in development and depends on your feedback. Expect errors and report them. I will diligently update as needed.

  • Example Card: http://fullthrottledevelopment.com/example-e-card
  • Example Pickup (where your recipient views the card): http://fullthrottledevelopment.com/viewcard/fcLGMR/

Release History

  • This plugin is in beta
  • 0.1 – Initial Release

Release History

  • 0.1 – Initial Release
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

  1. Upload ft-wp-ecards directory to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Create a new WordPress post or page
  4. Upload desired photos (photos must only be uploaded to post and not inserted into post)
  5. Insert [wpecards] ShortTag and publish
  6. Style to your specific needs
sections.faq:
Where can I find help or make suggestions?

http://fullthrottledevelopment.com/wp-ecards

How do I design the look of my ecards?

The look and feel of your ecards is managed by two separate aspects:

  • CSS – Every div, image, ul, li and form used has a CSS class or ID attached to it. If you find one that doesn’t, let me know.
